answers.answer:
Compensated medicines, or medicines reimbursed by the Health Fund, are drugs covered by the National Health and Welfare Fund, provided they are included in the List of compensated drugs approved through a Government's Decision.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section titled "Compensated medicine Medicines reimbursed by the Health Fund".
answers.bResponse:
Compensated medicines, or medicines reimbursed by the Health Fund, are drugs covered by the National Health and Welfare Fund, provided they are included in the List of compensated drugs approved through a Government's Decision.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section titled "Compensated medicine Medicines reimbursed by the Health Fund". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Patients within the social health insurance system are eligible to receive medicines covered by the National Health and Welfare Fund, provided they have a valid medical prescription for a drug included in the list of compensated drugs. Additionally, people fleeing the war in Ukraine are also eligible.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read the content under the main section titled "Compensated medicine".
answers.bResponse:
Patients within the social health insurance system are eligible to receive medicines covered by the National Health and Welfare Fund, provided they have a valid medical prescription for a drug included in the list of compensated drugs. Additionally, people fleeing the war in Ukraine are also eligible.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read the content under the main section titled "Compensated medicine". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Reimbursed medicines require an electronic medical prescription or a medical prescription with a special regime (green or yellow forms for psychotropic and narcotic drugs).

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines` and read under the section "Compensated medicine".
answers.bResponse:
Reimbursed medicines require an electronic medical prescription or a medical prescription with a special regime (green or yellow forms for psychotropic and narcotic drugs).

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines` and read under the section "Compensated medicine". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Yes, only drugs included in the List of compensated drugs, approved through a Government's Decision, can be prescribed and financially covered within the social health insurance system.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section "Compensated medicine Medicines reimbursed by the Health Fund" and "Compensation lists".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, only drugs included in the List of compensated drugs, approved through a Government's Decision, can be prescribed and financially covered within the social health insurance system.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section "Compensated medicine Medicines reimbursed by the Health Fund" and "Compensation lists". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Compensated medicines can only be dispensed by community pharmacies that have contracts with health insurance houses.

To find more detailed information, go to the website and read under the "Compensated medicine" and "Dispensing medicines in the pharmacy" sections.
answers.bResponse:
Compensated medicines can only be dispensed by community pharmacies that have contracts with health insurance houses.

To find more detailed information, go to the website and read under the "Compensated medicine" and "Dispensing medicines in the pharmacy" sections. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Compensated medicines can be prescribed by family medicine doctors or specialist doctors who work in a specialized outpatient clinic or hospital and are under contract with a health insurance house. Certain drugs, restricted by therapeutic protocols, can only be prescribed by a specialist doctor.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section titled "The prescribing doctor."
answers.bResponse:
Compensated medicines can be prescribed by family medicine doctors or specialist doctors who work in a specialized outpatient clinic or hospital and are under contract with a health insurance house. Certain drugs, restricted by therapeutic protocols, can only be prescribed by a specialist doctor.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section titled "The prescribing doctor." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Yes, certain drugs are restricted by therapeutic protocols and can only be prescribed by a specialist doctor. Compensated drugs can also be prescribed and financially covered for conditions found in the "Summary of product characteristics" or under the conditions provided in therapeutic protocols for those restricted drugs.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and refer to the sections titled "The prescribing doctor" and "Validity of electronic prescription".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, certain drugs are restricted by therapeutic protocols and can only be prescribed by a specialist doctor. Compensated drugs can also be prescribed and financially covered for conditions found in the "Summary of product characteristics" or under the conditions provided in therapeutic protocols for those restricted drugs.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and refer to the sections titled "The prescribing doctor" and "Validity of electronic prescription". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Prescriptions for chronic diseases can be issued for up to 90-92 days for stabilized patients, with the prescription generally valid for 30 days from issuance. If a patient is hospitalized in a facility that does not stock their specific chronic medication, family doctors or outpatient specialists can issue these prescriptions upon presentation of a hospital document confirming hospitalization.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and refer to the sections titled "The prescribing doctor" and "Validity of electronic prescription".
answers.bResponse:
Prescriptions for chronic diseases can be issued for up to 90-92 days for stabilized patients, with the prescription generally valid for 30 days from issuance. If a patient is hospitalized in a facility that does not stock their specific chronic medication, family doctors or outpatient specialists can issue these prescriptions upon presentation of a hospital document confirming hospitalization.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and refer to the sections titled "The prescribing doctor" and "Validity of electronic prescription". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Yes, medical prescriptions for compensated drugs can be issued after a remote consultation, particularly electronic medical prescriptions.

To find this detailed information, please go to the website and read under the section titled "The prescribing doctor," specifically the paragraph that discusses electronic medical prescriptions issued as a result of a remote consultation.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, medical prescriptions for compensated drugs can be issued after a remote consultation, particularly electronic medical prescriptions.

To find this detailed information, please go to the website and read under the section titled "The prescribing doctor," specifically the paragraph that discusses electronic medical prescriptions issued as a result of a remote consultation. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
For acute and subacute conditions, medical prescriptions are valid for a maximum of 48 hours. For chronic conditions, a prescription is valid for a maximum of 30 days from its issuance, and for stabilized chronic diseases with a stable therapeutic regimen, prescriptions can be valid for up to 92 days.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section "Validity of electronic prescription".
answers.bResponse:
For acute and subacute conditions, medical prescriptions are valid for a maximum of 48 hours. For chronic conditions, a prescription is valid for a maximum of 30 days from its issuance, and for stabilized chronic diseases with a stable therapeutic regimen, prescriptions can be valid for up to 92 days.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section "Validity of electronic prescription". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Yes, prescriptions for stabilized chronic diseases issued for a period of 90/91/92 days can be dispensed in installments for 30/31/32 days, provided they are prescribed online and signed with an extended electronic signature.

To find this detailed information, please go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section titled "Validity of electronic prescription".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, prescriptions for stabilized chronic diseases issued for a period of 90/91/92 days can be dispensed in installments for 30/31/32 days, provided they are prescribed online and signed with an extended electronic signature.

To find this detailed information, please go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section titled "Validity of electronic prescription". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
The reimbursement percentage for compensated medicines is determined by the specific medicinal product prescribed by the attending physician and its classification into sublists (A, B, C, or D), each corresponding to a different percentage (90%, 50%, 100%, or 20%).

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the section titled "Compensation lists".
answers.bResponse:
The reimbursement percentage for compensated medicines is determined by the specific medicinal product prescribed by the attending physician and its classification into sublists (A, B, C, or D), each corresponding to a different percentage (90%, 50%, 100%, or 20%).

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the section titled "Compensation lists". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Medicines can be compensated at different percentages: 90% for international common names (ICN) in sublist A, 50% for ICN in sublist B, 100% for ICN in sublist C, and 20% for ICN in sublist D.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines under the section "Compensation lists".
answers.bResponse:
Medicines can be compensated at different percentages: 90% for international common names (ICN) in sublist A, 50% for ICN in sublist B, 100% for ICN in sublist C, and 20% for ICN in sublist D.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines under the section "Compensation lists". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Yes, patients can collect compensated medicines from any pharmacy in the country that has a contract with health insurance houses, with the exception of medicines subject to cost-volume-result contracts.

To find this information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section "Dispensing medicines in the pharmacy".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, patients can collect compensated medicines from any pharmacy in the country that has a contract with health insurance houses, with the exception of medicines subject to cost-volume-result contracts.

To find this information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and read under the section "Dispensing medicines in the pharmacy". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines

answers.answer:
Yes, people fleeing the war in Ukraine are exempted from paying the personal contribution for medicines given in outpatient treatment.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and look under the section starting with "Attention!" or refer to the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, people fleeing the war in Ukraine are exempted from paying the personal contribution for medicines given in outpatient treatment.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines and look under the section starting with "Attention!" or refer to the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicines
